含义: The character '午' primarily means 'noon' or 'midday'. It is also used to denote the seventh of the twelve Earthly Branches in the traditional Chinese calendar system, which corresponds to the hour of the horse (11 AM to 1 PM).
字形: The character '午' is composed of a single radical, which is itself. It resembles a simple cross or a plus sign, symbolizing the sun at its zenith.
读音: The pronunciation of '午' is 'wǔ' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '午' originated from ancient pictographs representing the sun at its highest point in the sky. Over time, it evolved into its current simplified form.
成语: 日上三竿 (rì shàng sān gān) - the sun is three poles high (late morning)
午门斩首 (wǔ mén zhǎn shǒu) - beheading at the Meridian Gate
例句: 中午我们一起吃饭吧。 (Let's have lunch together at noon.)
下午三点有个会议。 (There is a meeting at 3 PM.)
短故事: In ancient China, the time of '午' was considered the peak of yang energy. It was believed that performing important tasks during this time would bring good luck and success.
There is a legend that during the Tang Dynasty, a scholar named Li Bai wrote his most famous poem 'Quiet Night Thoughts' at noon, inspired by the tranquility of the midday sun.
诗词: 《静夜思》 - 李白 (Quiet Night Thoughts - Li Bai)
床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。
《午日观竞渡》 - 边贡 (Watching the Dragon Boat Race at Noon - Bian Gong)
午日临江渚，竞渡看龙舟。
